intro: Sphaeradenia oxystigma, commonly known as the narrow-leafed shield fern, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a climbing or shrub-like plant characterized by its pinnate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically orange to red in color, which contain the seeds. Native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
